sentences.sContent: Chopin did not feel that his delicate technique and intricate melodies were as suited to the grandiose hall as they were to smaller environments and audiences.
sentences.sContent_eng: Chopin did not feel that his delicate technique and intricate melodies were as suited to the grandiose hall as they were to smaller environments and audiences.
sentences.sCn: 肖邦认为他细致优美的演奏技巧和纷繁的旋律更适合小环境演奏，而不适合宏伟的音乐厅。

synos.tran: 宏伟的；堂皇的；浮夸的；宏大的

remMethod.val: grandi(大的) + ose(多…的) → 多大(话)的 → 浮夸的

trans.tranOther: grandiose plans sound very important or impressive, but are not practical
